data.value: Given a function and distinct initial points, search in the downhill direction (as defined by the initial points) and return new points xa, xb, xc that bracket the minimum of the function f(xa) > f(xb) < f(xc). It doesn't always mean that obtained solution will satisfy xa<=x<=xb.
Maximum number of iterations to perform. Defaults to 1000.
Bracket the minimum of the function.
This function can find a downward convex region of a function:

signature.value: bracket(func, xa=0.0, xb=1.0, args=(), grow_limit=110.0, maxiter=1000)
